channel.title: Client for Mac
channel.description: Can somebody give me a link to a good client for the Mac besides MoparScape and Silab please? I mean a good one, not a peace of crap with 1/2 the real items on it. I don't want MoparScape because it skips when you're typing, and I don't want Silab because it lags too much on a Mac. I know this may be a lot to ask, but could someone please tell me what to do?

item.title: Client for Mac
item.dc:creator: @picostud picostud
item.description:
@picostud wrote:

Just make a jar, kill the batch files.

Read full topic

item.title: Client for Mac
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

Efete:

What EXACTLY do I type if the files is Users/efete/RUNEZAP_CLIENT/run.bat?[br][br][size=1]Posted on: April 01, 2008, 06:38:06 PM[/size][hr]Can somebody please help me? I’ve been at this for a while now.

-.-" seriously dude…a batch file is part of windows…

cd Users/efete/RUNEZAP_CLIENT/

then whatever code to execute your client

Read full topic

item.title: Client for Mac
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

Efete:

Okay, I’m a total newbie at this stuff, so can someone point me at a guide or post one please?

There isn’t one (that I know of). Your best bet is to just learn through trial and error.

Read full topic

item.title: Client for Mac
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

[quote=“Efete, post:4, topic:194899”][quote author=HcoJustin link=topic=259258.msg2150523#msg2150523 date=1207013261]
You can use any…seeing as Java is a platform-Independent language. However, what you will have to do is run the command line in a Console(whatever its called on mac)
[/quote] What command do I use in the console?[/quote]
same as you would for a batch…

java [-options] MainClass [args...]

and to execute a jar

java [-options] -jar JarFile [args...]

Read full topic
